title: On the Effective Description of Dynamically Broken SUSY-Theories
abstract: We introduce a new class of models describing dynamically broken supersymmetric theories at low energies. Our approach is a direct generalization of the known supersymmetric non-linear sigma models, but allows in contrast to the latter the description of dynamical supersymmetry breaking by non-perturbative non-semiclassical effects. It is especially useful within the context of quantum effective actions and the associated concept of symmetry breaking as a hysteresis effect.
